intro: Hieraciodes rubra, commonly known as the red-stemmed cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, reddish stems and small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are alternate and composed of five leaflets, giving it the common name "cinquefoil." Hieraciodes rubra is often found in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands at high elevations.
